title: Basics of Reinforcement Learning
description: From the agent-environment loop to Bellman equations, rewards, and your first OpenAI Gymnasium agent -- all from first principles.

notebooks.title: RL Foundations: The Four Elements
notebooks.objective: Compare RL to supervised and unsupervised learning, understand the four elements of RL (policy, reward, value function, model), and build a Tic-Tac-Toe agent that learns through self-play.

notebooks.title: MDPs, Rewards, and the Markov Property
notebooks.objective: Implement a complete MDP from scratch (the recycling robot), compute returns with and without discounting, verify the Markov property computationally, and find optimal policies through exhaustive search.

notebooks.title: Your First RL Agent with Gymnasium
notebooks.objective: Use OpenAI Gymnasium to interact with the CartPole environment, compare random agents to heuristic agents, and implement a Q-learning agent that learns to balance the pole from scratch.

caseStudy.title: RL-Guided Adaptive Dose Optimization for Chemotherapy
caseStudy.subtitle: NovaCure Therapeutics -- Personalizing Cancer Treatment Through Sequential Decision-Making
caseStudy.description: NovaCure's lead drug NC-4817 shows promising efficacy in Phase II trials for advanced non-small-cell lung cancer, but 34% of patients require dose reductions due to toxicity and 18% discontinue treatment entirely. An RL-guided adaptive dosing protocol models chemotherapy as an MDP, where the agent learns to personalize dose levels based on each patient's tumor response, blood counts, and toxicity grade.

curator.name: Dr. Rajat Dandekar
curator.title: Course Instructor
curator.bio: Dr. Rajat Dandekar is a researcher and educator specializing in AI/ML, with a passion for making complex concepts accessible through intuitive explanations and hands-on learning.
